page.title: 18FARMING
page.content: A typical farm in our area is called Swinburn's farm.It is an arable farm which has about 10 different kinds of crops growing in the fields.The farmer has to wake up at 3.00a.m.to milk the cows and then he puts them in a shed until it gets light.Then he puts them in a field to graze until 8:00 p.m. which is when he milks them again Mr.Swinburn owns a land coverage of 180 acres.On an average a day at Swinburns farm the hens lay 70 eggs.The usual machines that are used for the fields are a tractor and a combine harvester.The jobs that have to be done on an ordinary day are feeding animals,picking turnips and cleaning them.He has to transplant cabbages and in the late summer he has to cut hay and silage.
